Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. reached first base in the seventh inning and represented the winning run for the Yankees.
Chisholm stole second base despite a close call that was challenged by the Royals but ultimately upheld.
Alex Verdugo hit a line drive to left field, scoring Chisholm and giving the Yankees the lead.
Tommy Kahnle and Luke Weaver kept Kansas City scoreless over the final two innings.
Luke Weaver struck out Bobby Witt Jr. on a full count to bring the Royals down to their final out.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed disagreement with the call on Chisholm's steal after reviewing the play postgame.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. expressed confidence in his ability to steal bases and impact the game.
